form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Scott of Florida (for himself, Mr. Lee, Mr. Hawley, Mr. Moreno, and Mrs. Blackburn) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs

form.official-title: To designate the area of H Street Northwest between Connecticut Avenue Northwest and Vermont Avenue Northwest in Washington, District of Columbia, as Charlie Kirk Patriot Way.

section.header: Designation of Charlie Kirk Patriot Way

subsection.text: The area of H Street Northwest between Connecticut Avenue Northwest and Vermont Avenue Northwest in Washington, District of Columbia, shall be known and designated as Charlie Kirk Patriot Way.
Any reference in a law, map, regulation, document, paper, or other record of the United States to the area referred to in subsection (a) shall be deemed to be a reference to Charlie Kirk Patriot Way.
The District of Columbia shall construct 4 street signs—

paragraph.text: that contain the phrase Charlie Kirk Patriot Way;
one of which shall be placed immediately above the existing H Street Northwest sign at the intersection of H Street Northwest and Connecticut Avenue Northwest;
two of which shall be placed immediately above the two existing H Street Northwest signs at the intersection of H Street Northwest (Block 1500 and Block 1600) and 16th Street Northwest;
one of which shall be placed immediately above the existing H Street Northwest sign at the intersection of H Street Northwest and Vermont Avenue Northwest; and
that are similar in design and size to standard street signs used by the District of Columbia.
